intro: Tecoma nigricans, commonly known as black trumpet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces long, slender pods that contain seeds covered in a fine, hairy coating. Tecoma nigricans thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping in warm climates.
